medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced episodic unsteadiness beginning in his early 20s. The episodes lasted several hours, occurred 1 to 2 times per month until his 30s, and were often precipitated by emotional stress. After stopping acetazolamide due to cancer treatment, ataxic attacks recurred several times per week and were associated with slurred speech and severe pounding headaches.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a trial of acetazolamide at age 38, which rendered him attack-free until months after stopping the medication for treatment of squamous cell cancer of the neck.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother has mild episodes of gait instability and dysarthria, occurring several times per month since age 11. The patient's sister has severe vertigo, nausea, and inability to walk starting at age 12, with a history of frequent migraines.
